Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2009 07:42AM Asterix1234 wrote: Yes, op was at Southlake, Dr. Eng.  I feel so defeated and I am trying to reason with myself that this is nonsense barbe, it is not like I haven't been 'waiting' for one thing or another.....appointments, tests, results for months now, my impatience is irrational, yet very much there.  I telephoned his office on Friday at 3:00 and his secretary said that the results were in the computer, but that I would need to speak with him directly......no call, perhaps on Monday.  Where did you have surgery? What is a 'foobie', fake boob insert?  I've been walking around in sweatshirts, grateful for the cooler weather.  Thanks for the post again barbe, appreciate it. Deb
Posts.Title: I need help in the bedroom - any advice? Asterix1234 TaminMo

Posts.Content: Asterix1234 wrote: My Name is Debra.  I had a mastectomy with SNB one week ago today.  Although my husband has had a "glance" at my chest; closed with seri-strips, I don't know how I will go about making love with him.  I would be horrified to be without anything covering my incision....would anyone be kind enough to offer advice or share their experience.  I know this is a private and intimate subject, but I am lost.  I just don't know what to do - I only know that making love like we use to is not an option for me right now.  I love my husband and know that this is a powerful part of our relationship....he has been more than understanding and patient, but the day will soon come and I am worried and upset. Thank you to all for your inspiration and well wishes.  This forum is a haven of peace, experience, inspiration and knowledge.  Without all of you; I would surely be lost in so very many ways. God's speed,       Debra Dx 7/23/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 4/11 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I need help in the bedroom - any advice? Asterix1234 TaminMo

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2009 06:10AM Asterix1234 wrote: With tears gently falling from my eyes; I thank you with the utmost sincerity.  Your honesty is much appreciated, and your wife.......a lucky woman.  Pam is right, everyone is different - my DH puts his foot in his mouth often, but I know his intentions are good.  My path. FINALLY came back yesterday (op. 09/09/09) my 0/3 nodes was false positive....one neg. one cancer cells, one mets. More surgery this month and then on to chemo.  I miss the intimacy DH and I once had, I want it back, but I just cannot. With the knowledge that things will only get worse from here (for awhile anyway...) my head is saying "we need each other and just get on with it" but body and soul just aren't there. The waiting is crazy, yet today; I wish for the blissful ignorance of yesterday morning...this disease and the roller coaster ride it entails, absolutely stinks.  ((Hugs)) to all, take care; have a great week, be well and thank you again for all your insightful postings. Debra

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2009 05:26PM Asterix1234 wrote: Pam?  Your light and laughter is such a gift to us all, thank you and keep it up !   No news for me, although I sincerely thank you for your advice.  I found "guts" in my bottle of pain meds a week after surgery and now they and "that" are gone.  I know it has been said a thousand times before and I am far from being alone, but I feel horrible...."the new me?"  I look like a zombie!  I am a mess as of late, my operation was on 9/9/09 and still no path.  It seems difficult enough waiting for what they deem the alloted time, I think they have kinda gone over......the "waiting" all along has killed me....someone on this site said that cancer was god's way of teaching her patience.....must be something.  I am not having a pity party, I think I am both sad and REALLY angry...    Thank you again ladies, for the advice, the smiles and the wisdom. Be well, Debra

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2009 10:43PM Asterix1234 wrote: Thank you so much for taking the plunge 2new4Dee, I was afraid that no one would reply. I also appreciate the advice and will have my hubby go shopping for a couple of tube tops, maybe with same colored undies and we will call it lingerie!  I admit that I am still very antsy. Thank you again, Debra
Posts.Title: I need help in the bedroom - any advice? Asterix1234 TaminMo

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2009 09:39AM Asterix1234 wrote: Ladies, thank you so very much for your honest, candid replies.  I was lost. This is a big thing for us and where would I go for advice?  Friend, family??  Thank goodness you are here.  I was diagnosed in late July and could not be intimate with my DH, I felt "different", "diseased" and just could not.  At a time when I needed to feel his love, his acceptance, I simply could not.  I cannot imagine what he is going through or feeling and although we talk, feelings drown out words and the topic is lost. 2new4Dee - I purchased a tube top and work out bra (the kind that looks like a bathing suit top) yesterday, they hold a pleasant double purpose, I feel support against my chest which is comforting and I don't feel the skin move separately from the chest any more where surgery was...difficult to explain, but I think you might understand what I mean. This sensation of my skin sloshing on top of my chest was un-nerving.  The great thing about the tube top is that it does not hinder my infected SNB site.  I cannot thank you enough, and believe I will wear it constantly for the comfort it brings. Helena - reconstruction was not an option for me at the time of surgery, surgeon says that I will need to wait at least a year into treatment.  Then? Who knows? Going under the knife again is a little scary, I have also read the nightmare stories from women here about the pain involved with expansion, I had asked for "skin sparing" surgery, but he was not able to leave any, I will find out more details on the 25th. Where I have only one breast that is gone, I am concerned about "matching" them, I don't want to be pointing to the equator and drastically "south" at the same time.  DH says he is o.k. with my decision, whatever it may be and I have time to read more information and to give it more consideration.  Have you ever heard of duel implants for a mastectomy to make them even?  Prior to this experience, I often chastised men and my own hubby for putting far too much emphasis on boobs, but I see now that I have as well, it is part of my sexuality, part of being a woman, and now it is gone.  I have an indent on my chest where my little boob use to be and it will take some getting use to.  I miss.....me. Barbe - How intimate!  That sounds like one incredible man you have.  How did this happen? Did you ask him for help or did he initiate it?  I would be so worried about asking my husband to do something that horrified or grossed him out.  What a terrible thing...the very thought that my body would disgust him. This topic is so difficult as it digs into the personal at a deep level, but it is forefront in what I am dealing with, it is not me who was afflicted with cancer, rather my entire family.  Perhaps DH and I could go shopping in a month or so and pick out a few things together.  A little diddy with pre-filled boobs would work rather swell !! Thank you again for your honesty, for being open and for sharing.  If you have any additional advice or comments, I would love to hear from you again.   Gods speed. All the best and (hugs) to you all   -   Debra
Posts.Title: I need help in the bedroom - any advice? Asterix1234 TaminMo

Thank you, thank you, thank you all (hugs....)  I will continue to check for replies. Sincerely,    Debra

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2009 04:59PM Asterix1234 wrote: Hello ladies, I had my port inserted this morning and am in considerable pain.....second round of chemo (FEC-D) on Wednesday x 8 in total, so 7 more to go....my girls (6 yrs and 10 yrs) shaved my head prior to my first chemo the middle of November, with so very little out of my control, at least we as a family could share in the 'decision' of when the hair went.  Thank you, thank you, thank you for being here, you are my strength, my courage and my inspiration !  I would truely be lost without this site.  (((gentle hugs to everyone)))  Deb
